reviews.text: I gave this hotel a 4 and not a 3 because it was above average, for the price. However this is an average hotel.
reviews.title: Great on a Budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is clean, friendly and the bathrooms are new, which makes a big difference.
reviews.title: Good Budget Option

reviews.text: But the best thing about this place is the location! Right on Las Ramblas. I did not find it noisy, since my room was in the back, But you don't go to Barcelona to sleep anyways.
reviews.title: Great palce to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location, rooms small and in need of modernisation but clean. Ramblas view rooms are noisy at night but worth it for people-watching. Staff friendly and helpful. Would stay here again if on a budget.
reviews.title: Stay away!

reviews.text: Great value for your money. Situated on las Ramblas, but cheaper than others nearby. Basic hotel with clean rooms w/ AC (a bit noisy) and friendly personnel.
reviews.title: great price for location!
Be aware
reviews.text: Be aware. I booked a room for this upcoming November 2006 and my credit card has already been charged in full 5 months in advance. This fact as well as their cancellation policy is not stated on their web site anywhere. The overwhelming majority of hotels charge your credit card after your hotel stay. Not 5 months before.
Well, after reading the reviews before booking we packed ear plugs, and needed the them!!
reviews.title: As expected

reviews.text: The rooms were very clean but a bit dated, small by US standards but not for europe.
reviews.title: Wouldn't Stay Here Again

reviews.text: We had a balcony which overlooked La Ramblas, great for people watching but not for sleeping, fortunatuly we had packed ear plugs and eye masks which came in usefull.
reviews.title: Second visit - still great

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and we were able to store our luggage after we checked out on the last day FOC.
reviews.title: Excellent location, very clean and would stay there again

reviews.text: Stayed here 11/11-13/05. Had absolutely no problems. Hotel is older but had an updated bathroom that was probably the cleanest I've seen anywhere. Room was a double and small by US standards but average by European standards I guess. We had a balcony room that overlooked Las Ramblas -- if you're a light sleeper bring earplugs, this is not a quiet place and the older door doesn't do much to muffle the street sounds. But if you want a truly fantastic vacation moment (like I did) the noise is worth it just to stand out on your little balcony at night and watch the river of people flowing by below. Really beautiful. Super great location, within walking distance of the cathedral, Barri Gotic, the ports, restaurants, shopping, most of the Gaudi highlights including Casa Battlo, La Pedrera, Palau Guell (although Palau Guell is closed until Dec 06). Even Sagrada Familia is walkable (although a little bit of a hike).
reviews.title: no problems, no regrets
Pleasantly suprised
reviews.text: Only inconvenience is short flight of stairs from the front door to the check-in(narrow and hard to navigate when dragging baggage) and having to turn in my key to the desk each time I left the room. Staff was VERY kind and helpful, pointing out places to see on the map. There is a younger man that is there most of the time who speaks English and an older gentleman who speaks a little but is very kind and patient with poor Spanish speakers such as myself! There are metro stops really close by if you want to try to get the metro from the airport, other wise a cab ride is 20-25 euro.
Great, great location, inexpensive (3 nights for 2 people including a continental breakfast was 210 euro) and clean. Not much else I need!
reviews.title: Great location!
Great place to stay
reviews.text: Moved into this hotel after leaving hotel we booked on the internet. This hotel is a little dated, but rooms are very clean and relatively spacious. Balcony opened to a side street and it was very noisy when we left the balcony door open. Staff is very friendly and the vibe at the hotel is good. Spacious lobby and dining room with cute balcony tables that you can sit at overlooking the Ramblas. Location is a block from Catalonia Plaza, at the top of the Ramblas.

When the taxi driver dropped us in front of the hotel and we walked in, we were a little put off by the stairs! After traveling, we were not prepaired to lug our suitcases up the stairs and then one by one, take ourselves up the elevator to the lobby. But we survived.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location, Great Price!

likes.disliked: — The stairs up to the front desk. Noisy at night.

reviews.text: We were upgraded to a room with a Ramblas view, which we thought was great....until we tried to sleep that night! VERY noisy at all hours of the night. Bring your earplugs, or request a room without a view.
reviews.title: I think it's a great deal for the price

likes.disliked: — Steps leading up to the reception. Being a single female traveller, had to carry the luggage up the stairs which was pretty tiring

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was quite small, but tidy. Definitely nothing fancy. The shower in our room didn't work all that well. For the price, it's worth it. The location is fantastic - walk to Plaza Catalunya, Barri Gotic, markets...everything. No need to take a cab back to the airport, just take the Aerobus from Plaza Catalunya for $3.75!!
reviews.title: Clean, Nice & Friendly

reviews.text: I would stay there again for the price and location, but if it's atmosphere that you want, this is not the place for you!
reviews.title: Frendly stuff
Great location and price - clean and friendly
